TopicTitle: Is there a way to spawn flags?

Articles.Content:
So I finally managed to land on the mun , and what's more by chance I landed next to the stone arch!

So I planted my flag, but then I accidentally took it down , after checking my over kerbals for flags and finding they had none, I wondered (and hoped) if there was a way to spawn flags?

So is there?

Edited July 25, 2013 by SergeantBlueforce
Marking as answered
I thought it was possible to regain your flag by putting your Kerbal in the capsule and back out again, but I might be mistaken.
I'm pretty sure than quicksaving and quickloading does the job too, or simply leaving to the space center and then coming back.

Yeah get in the Capsule again and after you exit your Kerbal with have another Flag. As for the Quicksaving / Loading thing, this has worked a few times for me, but not always. Best bet is the Capsule.
how did you take it down? a kerbal can pick up and re-place a flag. They also get fresh flags if they enter a command pod or lander module.

how did you take it down? a kerbal can pick up and re-place a flag. They also get fresh flags if they enter a command pod or lander module.

If you get near a flag, if you click it there's two options: take down and read plaque.
I right clicked take down by accident on the flag.

Yeah get in the Capsule again and after you exit your Kerbal with have another Flag.

Worked! Thanks!
